page.title: 01OVERVIEW OF THE AREA.
page.content: This block of land is bounded by the village of{Wyboston}to the west and farmland to the east of{Little {Barford.}The northern edge runs along the present southern boundaries of{ {Eaton Socon, Eynesbury}and{St.Neots,} following the route of the new{ {St.Neots Bypass. }The county boundary between{Bedfordshire}and Cambridgeshire crosses the area. The{ {A1, River Great Ouse}and{main East {Coast railway line}(Kings Cross to Edinburgh) all travel in an approximately north/south direction through the block. Most of the area is farmland devoted to{Market Gardening {or Arable}but some{cattle}are grazed on riverside meadows. There are two villages within the block, namely{ {Little Barford}and{Wyboston.}It also includes the Barford Power Station and some new industrial building.
